intro: Passovia phaeoclados, commonly known as the dark-leaved pasqueflower, is a rare and striking member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its deep green, velvety leaves and showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. This plant is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its flowering period occurs in early spring, making it one of the first blooms of the season in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
